intro: Galium baghlanense, commonly known as the Baghlan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are opposite, often with a hairy texture. Galium baghlanense typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
